toggle.heading: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: Best National University Rankings
hero.description: Schools in the National Universities category, such as the University of Chicago and Carnegie Mellon University, offer a full range of undergraduate majors, plus master's and doctoral programs. These colleges also are committed to producing groundbreaking research.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

satAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1826, Mississippi College is a private institution. Mississippi College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered more selective.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: At Missouri State University, students can explore more than 300 campus organizations, fraternities and sororities, community service programs, and Division I sports. Notable alumni include actor John Goodman, who starred in the television show Roseanne and in movies such as The Big Lebowski, O Brother, Where Art Thou?, and Raising Arizona.
Founded in 1867, Morgan State University is a public institution.
National Louis University is a private institution. National Louis University follows a quarter-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered least selective.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Students at Northern Illinois University can join more than 200 clubs, about 40 Greek-letter organizations and numerous Division I sports teams. Notable NIU alumni include Dan Castellaneta, who voices several characters on the animated television show "The Simpsons."

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1968, Northern Kentucky University is a public institution. Northern Kentucky University offers a Greek system, where 7 percent of the student body is involved in a sorority and 10% is involved in a fraternity.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Located about 30 miles northwest of Detroit, Oakland University is in the suburb of Rochester, Michigan. Classes at Oakland are usually small, often with fewer than 35 students, and only 1 percent of courses are taught by graduate assistants.

institution.displayName: Our Lady of the Lake University
institution.linkedDisplayName: Our Lady of the Lake University

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1895, Our Lady of the Lake University is a private institution. The school has 67.5% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Our Lady of the Lake University is 10:1.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Palm Beach Atlantic University is situated along the coast in West Palm Beach, Florida. The university is an interdenominational Christian institution.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.
institution.displayName: Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico--Ponce
institution.linkedDisplayName: Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico--Ponce

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

items.blurb: Founded in 1948, Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico--Ponce is a private institution. Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico--Ponce follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered least selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: More than 974,900 international students attended U.S. colleges and universities during the 2014-2015 school year.
